algorithm_technique: Two pointers to iterate from both ends, counting vowels in each half.
problem_summary_simple: Check if the number of vowels in the first half of a string equals the second half.
problem_summary_technical: Compare vowel counts in two halves of an even-length string using two pointers and a vowel set.
key_insights: The problem can be solved by comparing vowel counts in the two halves.
Two pointers efficiently traverse the string from both ends simultaneously.
A set provides O(1) average time complexity for vowel lookups.
